div.l: But yef he wolde be slayn of symkyn̄
With panade or wiþ knyf or boydekyn
For Ielousie folk ben ꝑperlous euer mo
Algate þey wolde her wyues wend so Noᵃta
And eke she was sumdel smotirliche
She was as digne as water in a dicche
As ful of hoker and bismar͗e
Hir thouȝte a lady shuld hir spar͗e
What for hir kynrede and hir norcerie
That she had lerned in þe nonnerie
A douȝtir had they betwyx him two
Of xxᵗⁱ wynter age age with outen ony moo
Sauyng a Child that was half yer͗e of age
In Cradil it lay and was a ꝓpropre page
This wenche thikke and wel I growen was
With Cammoys nose and yen gray as glas
With buttokkes brode and brestes round and hie
But ryȝt fayr was hir here I will not lye
The ꝑperson of þe toun̄ for she was fayr͗e
In purpos was to make hir his ayr͗e
Bothe of his catell and his mesuage
And straunge he made hit of hir mariagemarigemariage
Hys purpos was to sette hem hiȝe
In to some blod of noble noble auncetrie
For holy chrche good mot be dispendit
On holy chirche blod þat is descendit
Therfore he wolde his holy blod honoure
Thowȝ that he holy chirche shuld deuoure
Grete sokyn hath þis millere out of doute
Off whete and malt of al þe contre aboute
And namely ther was a grete collage
Men clepēn hit þe soler halle at Cantebrygge
There was hir whete and hir malt y grounde
And on a day it happed in astounde
Sike lay the mancuple on a maladie
Men wende wisteli þat he shuld die
For whiche this miller͗e stale boþe mele and corn̄
An hundrid tyme thanne more þan biforn̄
